intro: Hoffmannseggia glabra var. intricata, commonly known as the woolly burpea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring succulent leaves that store water. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Hoffmannseggia glabra var. intricata is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions with minimal water requirements.
